text: Bufo apolobambicus is a species of toad. They belong to the family Bufonidae. They live in Bolivia and Peru. Their habitat is subtropical or tropical forest. Their population is dying because of habitat loss. ==References== * De La Riva, I. 2006. Bufo apolobambicus . 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 21 July 2007. Category:Toads Category:Frogs of South America
title: Bufo apolobambicus
